SEARCH
Package backend

Class Game

java.lang.Object
backend.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class represents the main gameplay logic, controlling the flow of the game, managing questions, and tracking the player and monsters' states. It handles game initialization, difficulty settings, and responses to player's actions during the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(String UserEmail, int difficultyLevel)
      Constructs a new Game instance. Initializes game elements including monsters and the player character based on the specified difficulty level, and loads an appropriate set of questions.
      Parameters:
      UserEmail - Email of the user playing the game, used for score tracking (currently unused in constructor).
      difficultyLevel - The difficulty level of the game, affecting monster difficulty and questions.

  • Method Details

    • getCharacter

      public Character getCharacter()

      public void setQuestionBank(ArrayList<Question> questionBank)

    • generateQuestion

      public Question generateQuestion()

    • answerWrong

      public String answerWrong()
      Processes the player's incorrect answer, reducing the character's life and determining the game state.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the next state ("game end" if game is over, otherwise indicates question change).

    • answerRight

      public String answerRight()
      Handles a correct answer from the player, affecting the monsters' health and potentially ending the game.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the game's next state based on the result of the answer.

    • calculateMarks

      public int calculateMarks(int timeLeft)
      Calculates and returns the player's score based on the time left, remaining lives, and questions answered.
      Parameters:
      timeLeft - The time left in the game.
      Returns:
      The calculated score.

    • calculateQuestions

      public int calculateQuestions(ArrayList<Monster> monsters)
      Calculates the number of questions correctly answered based on the monsters' health. Used internally to determine the final score.
      Parameters:
      monsters - The list of monsters in the game.
      Returns:
      The number of questions correctly answered.
